intro: Steironema heterophyllum, commonly known as the narrow-leaf false lily, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It is a member of the Amaryllidaceae family and is characterized by its slender, grass-like leaves and showy, bell-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments, such as forests and wetlands. Its flowers are usually white or pale pink and bloom in clusters. Steironema heterophyllum is often cultivated for its ornamental value due to its attractive foliage and unique floral display.
